Detailed Description

Common interface for the management of the dynamic selection constraints.

Definition at line 19 of file IOptionsManager.h.

enum iprm::IOptionsManager::OptionOperationFlags

Bitwise coded flags used to find out supported features.

Enumerator
OOF_COUNT_FIXED 

Active if number of parameters is fixed.

OOF_SUPPORT_RENAME 

Active if rename of parameters is supported.

OOF_SUPPORT_INSERT 

Active if insert of parameters is possible.

OOF_SUPPORT_DELETE 

Active if delete of parameters is possible.

OOF_SUPPORT_SWAP 

Active if swap of parameters with the other one is possible.

OOF_DISABLE_ALLOWED 

Active if it is possible to get the disabled option.

OOF_SUPPORT_ENABLING 

Active if enabling and disabling of the parameters is possible.

Definition at line 28 of file IOptionsManager.h.

Member Function Documentation

virtual int iprm::IOptionsManager::GetOptionOperationFlags ( int  index = -1) const
pure virtual

Get operation control flags of some option or whole manager.

Parameters
indexindex addressing position in the option list. For negative value general flags are returned. For example if you want to check if there is any re-nameable element you should call it with negative index value. To check if first element can be renamed call it with index value 0. To check if you can insert at the last position please use index value equal to current options count.

Implemented in iprm::COptionsManager, iprm::CParamsManagerComp, and iprm::CMultiParamsManagerComp.

virtual bool iprm::IOptionsManager::InsertOption ( const QString &  optionName,
const QByteArray &  optionId,
const QString &  optionDescription = QString(),
int  index = -1 
)
pure virtual

Insert an option at some position.

Parameters
optionNameName of the option
optionIdID of the option, according to data model constraints needs to be unique
optionDescriptionDescription of the option
indexPosition in the list, where the new option will be inserted. Negative value means that the option will be added to the end of the list. Returns true if the operation was successful.

Implemented in iprm::COptionsManager, iprm::CParamsManagerComp, and iprm::CMultiParamsManagerComp.

pure virtual
